title: Message IX, Job 9:29--'If I Be Wicked, Why Then Labour I in Vain?'
credit_line: Gift of Aluminum Company of America
provenance_text:
Mathias Goeritz [1915-1990], San Angel, Mexico; Carstairs Gallery, New York, NY, until January 15, 1962 [1]; G. David Thompson [1899-1965], Pittsburgh, PA, January 15, 1962 until June 26, 1965 [2]; G. David Thompson estate, June 1965-November 1966; The Aluminum Company of America, Pittsburgh, PA, November 1966 until October 4, 1984 [3]; gift to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, October 1984.

Notes:
[1]. The work was included (no. 128, illustrated in the catalogue) in "The 1961 Pittsburgh International Exhibition of Contemporary Painting and Sculpture" held at Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, October 1961 - January 1962. It was lent by Carstairs Gallery.
[2]. Mr. Thompson purchased the work from the International for $3,000. Acknowledgement of payment by Carstairs Gallery is dated January 15, 1962. See copy of correspondence with the gallery in curatorial file and Photograph 23.61 in G. David Thompson archives, CMOA.  
[3]. Part of the Alcoa Collection of Contemporary Art.  This work was included in an exhibition of works acquired by Alcoa from the G. David Thompson collection (no. 17, illustrated in the catalogue) held at Carnegie Institute in 1967, followed by a multi-year national tour.
